pageTitle: Itinerary for Wednesday, March 8, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Wednesday, March 8, 2017:

Ottawa, Ontario

8:15 a.m. The Prime Minister and the Minister of International Development and La Francophonie, Marie-Claude Bibeau, will make an announcement and hold a panel discussion on Canada’s commitment to promoting and defending the rights of women and girls globally.

Sir John A. Macdonald Building
144 Wellington Street
Ottawa, Ontario

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage for announcement and panel discussion
  • Media should arrive no later than 7:45 a.m.
  • Accreditation from the Canadian Parliamentary Press Gallery is required. For more information, contact Marc Fortier at Marc.fortier@parl.gc.ca

9:15 a.m. The Prime Minister and the Minister of International Development and La Francophonie will hold a media availability.

Sir John A. Macdonald Building
144 Wellington Street
Ottawa, Ontario

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media should arrive no later than 7:45 a.m.
  • Accreditation from the Canadian Parliamentary Press Gallery is required. For more information, contact Marc Fortier at Marc.fortier@parl.gc.ca

10:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will attend the National Caucus meeting.

12:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend Equal Voice’s Historic Seating of Daughters of the Vote in the House of Commons and will deliver remarks.

House of Commons
Parliament Hill
Ottawa, Ontario

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Accreditation from the Canadian Parliamentary Press Gallery is required. For more information, contact Marc Fortier at Marc.fortier@parl.gc.ca

2:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend Question Period.

Toronto, Ontario

6:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a dinner with BlackRock executives and members of the Board of Directors.

Closed to media
